#HelloFrom Lofoten Islands, Norway. ‚ÄúThis village is home to just 510 people, most of them fishermen,‚Äù says photographer Lennart Pagel (@lennart). ‚ÄúInstead of bleachers, the football [soccer] field is surrounded by wooden racks to dry fish.‚Äù ‚Å£
‚Å£
Photo by @lennart

Self-taught artist Meliany Surya‚Äôs (@lady_meli_art) mandala and doodle artworks combine color, lines, patterns and geometry in fresh and imaginative ways. This October, Meliany is participating in #inktober for the first time, challenging herself to make new work on a daily basis. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt follow any instructions to make a specific drawing in a day. I just draw what‚Äôs in my mind,‚Äù she says.‚Å£
‚Å£
#ThisWeekOnInstagram show us how you express yourself through the things you love. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Å£
‚Å£
Please submit your own photos and videos to the project using the #ThisWeekOnInstagram hashtag. Any tagged visual shared with the hashtag is eligible for the project and, if selected, to be featured.‚Å£
‚Å£
Photos by @lady_meli_art

Designer, illustrator and mushroom enthusiast Sarah Graham (@ohemsarahgee) became interested in fungi about six years ago. ‚ÄúI started to seek out solitude in nature, which turned into an unquenchable curiosity to understand the things around me,‚Äù she says. This October, Sarah is taking part in #inktober, an annual challenge where artists all over the world create one ink drawing each day of the month.‚Å£
‚Å£
#ThisWeekOnInstagram show us how you express yourself through the things you love. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Å£ ‚Å£

Tag along with @alvssa_ for a few photo shoots on the streets of Perth on today‚Äôs episode of #DoYouFollow, our new series which dives deep into some of Instagram‚Äôs most popular interests and the people who make them awesome. üíõ

#DoYouFollow streetwear influencer @alvssa_? When she‚Äôs not in her room prepping her next outfit, she‚Äôs most likely on the streets of Perth finding the perfect spot for the next photo-op. üì∏‚Å£
‚Å£
In our new series #DoYouFollow, we‚Äôre diving deep into some of Instagram‚Äôs most popular interests and the people who make them awesome. Learn more about Alyssa on IGTV, and check out some more looks from around the globe from the #streetwear community on today‚Äôs story. üëüüß¢‚Å£

Photos by @alvssa_

Caroline Rondeau‚Äôs (@cac0tte) drawings generally convey inner peace and soft expression, but for the month of October she adds a little spooky touch.‚Å£
‚Å£
‚ÄúThe work I make for #inktober is pretty different than the others,‚Äù says the freelance illustrator and yoga teacher.‚Å£ ‚ÄúMost of the time I stay in pastel tones, soft light pink is my favorite color. So all this black and white puts me way outside of my comfort zone ‚Äî but isn‚Äôt it here that great things are supposed to happen?‚Äù‚Å£
‚Å£
Photo by @cac0tte

After being made fun of by her teacher and fellow classmates for the color of her skin, Kheris Rogers (@kherispoppin) decided to send a powerful message to her bullies by turning their negativity into a powerful and uplifting message for others. ‚ÄúMy vision for the future is everyone being themselves and loving themselves on the inside and out,‚Äù says Kheris. ‚ÄúI just love my complexion. I love who I am.‚Äù‚Å£
‚Å£
In honor of National Bullying Prevention month, we‚Äôve partnered with @teenvogue to share stories of #Advocates who are taking a stand against bullying and sparking positive global change. ‚ú®Learn more about Kheris on IGTV now.

Meet Kheris Rogers (@kherispoppin). She‚Äôs the 13-year-old CEO and designer behind Flexin‚Äô In My Complexion, a clothing line on a mission to empower young people to be confident in their own skin. üíñ‚úäüíï‚ú®‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt matter what others think of you. It only matters what you think of yourself,‚Äù says Kheris. ‚ÄúYou shouldn‚Äôt let what other people say get into your head, because you know that you‚Äôre beautiful and special. And that‚Äôs basically what my message is behind Flexin‚Äô In My Complexion.‚Äù üíï‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
For National Bullying Prevention Month, we partnered with Teen Vogue (@teenvogue) to share stories and support amazing #Advocates who are taking a stand against bullying and making a positive global impact. See how Kheris is standing up to bullies and encouraging others to do the same on IGTV! ‚ú®

Meet today‚Äôs #WeeklyFluff: His name is Arlo... but he‚Äôs better known as the Dark Lord (@the.dark_lord). People always want to know if he‚Äôs as evil as he seems... the answer is yes!‚Å£
‚Å£
The Dark Lord will be celebrating Halloween in New York this year, scaring trick-or-treaters whenever he gets a chance.‚Å£
‚Å£
Photo by @the.dark_lord

When Sarah Ritchie (@jeansararichards) was 6 years old, Diamond, her first pet snake, entered her life. üêç But it wasn‚Äôt until age 19 that she became more interested in keeping snakes as pets. ‚ÄúI became obsessed with all the morphs and species people are breeding. I now have some very unique animals that are stunning but were entirely for companionship when I needed some creatures around.‚Äù ‚Å£
‚Å£
Sarah now keeps five snakes at home in Calgary, Alberta, where she‚Äôs on the hunt for good light and simple backgrounds for her photos. üñ§‚Å£
‚Å£
To see Sarah‚Äôs work and the mesmerizing movements of her slippery companions, go watch today‚Äôs story.

#HelloFrom Nienhagen‚Äôs Ghost Forest ‚Äî straight out of a German fairy tale. üìïüê∫‚Å£
‚Å£
Photo by @jannikobenhoff

‚ÄúOur whole year is planned around #Halloween,‚Äù says designer Steve Wintercroft, whose environmentally conscious company Wintercroft (@wintercroft) creates digital templates that enable people to make DIY masks from recycled, everyday materials. ‚ÄúThe mask designs are inspired by many different themes: animals, characters from folklore, myth, tribal dress, deities. More recently, we‚Äôve been creating our own characters and narratives around the masks,‚Äù he says.‚Å£
‚Å£
